intro: Ornithogalum nebrodense, commonly known as the Nebrod Alps bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces clusters of white to pale blue flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. Ornithogalum nebrodense thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats.
